content: Hey, what would be the better name for our usage of E-mentor? It was cargo culted from Rust, but it doesn't mean that the issue has an active mentoring person. Rather, it means something more specific and immediate -- the issue includes pointers to relevant code and/or tests.
It's still a good idea to look for this label if you want something you can start with easily, but I worry that the current name inflates expectations.
:raised_hand: my expectations were a bit inflated at first ;)
I wish we could do a real E-mentor, but it doesn't seem feasible at the moment sadly :-(
Hm, I guess, E-has-instructions would be a good name
i think being approachable on zulip is already very helpful
Same for me :) I had this kind of expactations regarding the label :) but yes, at least being available for some questions on zulip or in the issue if it's feasible is already very helpful
